hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: Recall the forward, backward, and centered finite-difference formulas.

worksheet.stem:
Compute forward and backward difference approximations of O(h) and O(h2), and central difference approximations of O(h2) and O(h4) for the first derivative of y = sin x at x = π ∕ 4 using a value of h = π /12. Estimate the true percent relative error εt for each approximation. (Round the final answers to five decimal places and the percent relative error to two decimal places.)

 

The results are summarized as follows:

 

  First order Second order
Forward __a__ __b__
εt __c__% __d__%
Backward __e__ __f__
εt __g__% __h__%
Centered __i__ __j__
εt __k__% __l__%
worksheet.commonFeedback:
The data needed for this problem is as follows:

xi – 2 = 0.26179             f(xi – 2) = 0.25882

xi – 1 = 0.52359              f(xi – 1) = 0.5

xi = 0.78539                f(xi) = 0.70711

xi + 1 = 1.04719             f(xi + 1) = 0.86603

xi + 2 = 1.30899              f(xi + 1) = 0.96593

 

true = cos(π/4) = 0.70711

internal_category.title: ABET Outcomes: (a) an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering

property.name: problemSolution
property.value:
The acceleration of the particle is 0.01509 m/s2.

True percent relative error is 0.006%.

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: Recall the formula of Richardson extrapolation.

worksheet.stem:
The velocity (m/s) of an object at time t seconds is given by

 

%media:formula19.mml%

 

Using Richardson’s extrapolation, find the acceleration of the particle at time t = 5 s using h = 0.5 and 0.25. Employ the exact solution to compute the true percent relative error of each estimate. (Round the acceleration of the particle to five decimal places and the error to three decimal places.)

 

The acceleration of the particle is __a__ m/s2.

True percent relative error is __b__ %.
